      static java.lang.String[] codify​(java.lang.String[] message, int a, int b, int c)
      Takes an array of one-char sized Strings, and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys).
      static java.lang.String[] decodeMessageArr​(java.lang.String[] hiddenMessageArr, int a, int b, int c)
      Decode each char (single-char String to be more precise) within an Array of codified chars (single-char Strings).
      static java.lang.String descramble​(java.lang.String cipher, int[][] paramArr)
      Descramble an encrypted message.
      static void display2DArray​(int[][] arr)
      Display a 2D array.
      static int[] getSecretParameters​(java.lang.String cipher, java.lang.String keyword)
      Takes a String cipher and a String keyword; test possible values for codifying parameters (secret keys) a, b, c in the secret code, so that a matching keyword is found within the cipher; returns an int array representing the secret keys in the following format: {a, b, c}; not actually used: see getSecretParametersImproved() just below.
      static int[][] getSecretParametersImproved​(java.lang.String cipher, java.lang.String keyword)
      Takes a String cipher and a String keyword, test possible values for codifying parameters (secret keys) a, b, c in the secret code, so that a matching keyword is found within the cipher; Like getSecretParameters, but in case multiple arrays of parameter values match for the given keyword (multiple plausible arrays of secret keys exist): this is the one I will be using.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      static java.lang.String scramble​(java.lang.String message, int a, int b, int c)
      Takes a message and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys), returns a cipher message.

      Takes a char, its attributed index and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys), returns the codified int value of the char in single-char String format, modifying the codifying algorithm based on its attributed index position.
      static long toUnicode​(char ch)
      Takes a char, returns the long unicode value of the char.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • scramble

        public static java.lang.String scramble​(java.lang.String message,
                                        int a,
                                        int b,
                                        int c)
        Takes a message and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys), returns a cipher message.
        Parameters:
        message - String that you want to scramble.
        a - int, first secret key.
        b - int, second secret key.
        c - int, third secret key.
        Returns:
        String, encrypted message.

      • codify

        public static java.lang.String[] codify​(java.lang.String[] message,
                                        int a,
                                        int b,
                                        int c)
        Takes an array of one-char sized Strings, and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys).
        Parameters:
        message - String[], an array of one-char Strings representing a message to codify.
        a - int, first secret key.
        b - int, second secret key.
        c - int, third secret key.
        Returns:
        String[], an array of numbers representing the codified message.

      • theSecretCode

        public static java.lang.String theSecretCode​(char currentChar,
                                             int index,
                                             int a,
                                             int b,
                                             int c)
        Takes a char, its attributed index and 3 codifying parameters (secret keys), returns the codified int value of the char in single-char String format, modifying the codifying algorithm based on its attributed index position.
        Parameters:
        currentChar - char, the current char to evaluate.
        index - int, the index to attribute to the codified char; will influence the algorithm used to codify the char.
        a - int, the first secret key.
        b - int, the second secret key.
        c - int, the first secret key.
        Returns:
        The codified value of the char, as a String.

      • toUnicode

        public static long toUnicode​(char ch)
        Takes a char, returns the long unicode value of the char.
        Parameters:
        ch - char, the char for whom to get the unicode value from.
        Returns:
        the unicode value of the char in long type format.

      • getSecretParameters

        public static int[] getSecretParameters​(java.lang.String cipher,
                                        java.lang.String keyword)
        Takes a String cipher and a String keyword; test possible values for codifying parameters (secret keys) a, b, c in the secret code, so that a matching keyword is found within the cipher; returns an int array representing the secret keys in the following format: {a, b, c}; not actually used: see getSecretParametersImproved() just below.
        Parameters:
        cipher - String, the cipher to search.
        keyword - String, the keyword to search for in the cipher.
        Returns:
        The secret keys that matched for the given keyword in the cipher.

      • getSecretParametersImproved

        public static int[][] getSecretParametersImproved​(java.lang.String cipher,
                                                  java.lang.String keyword)
        Takes a String cipher and a String keyword, test possible values for codifying parameters (secret keys) a, b, c in the secret code, so that a matching keyword is found within the cipher; Like getSecretParameters, but in case multiple arrays of parameter values match for the given keyword (multiple plausible arrays of secret keys exist): this is the one I will be using.
        Parameters:
        cipher - String, the cipher to search.
        keyword - String, the keyword to search for in the cipher.
        Returns:
        an int[3] array representing plausible arrays of secret keys in the following format: {{a, b, c}, {a, b, c}, {a, b, c}, ...}; it is likely to only return one set of plausible keys, the other sub-arrays being only empty ones.

      • display2DArray

        public static void display2DArray​(int[][] arr)
        Display a 2D array.
        Parameters:
        arr - int[][], 2D array to print to std.out.

      • descramble

        public static java.lang.String descramble​(java.lang.String cipher,
                                          int[][] paramArr)
        Descramble an encrypted message.
        Parameters:
        cipher - String, the encrypted message to decrypt.
        paramArr - int[][], 2D Array storing the plausible secret keys, each set of plausible keys being represented by each sub-array; it is likely to only contain one valid set of keys.
        Returns:
        String, the descrambled message

      • decodeMessageArr

        public static java.lang.String[] decodeMessageArr​(java.lang.String[] hiddenMessageArr,
                                                  int a,
                                                  int b,
                                                  int c)
        Decode each char (single-char String to be more precise) within an Array of codified chars (single-char Strings).
        Parameters:
        hiddenMessageArr - String[], an array of codified char values.
        a - int, the first secret key.
        b - int, the second secret key.
        c - int, the third secret key.
        Returns:
        an array of one-char Strings, each String representing a Unicode char that was held in the array of coded chars.
